pullrequest.title: add slider teleop for drc_vehicle using cheats

content.raw:
The exit car doesn't seem to work for me. I tried adding some code to send 'nominal' to atlas/mode, but the buttons are acting weird.
~~~
diff -r 7ac1e149f82e tutorials/atlas_teleop/drc_vehicle_teleop.py
--- a/tutorials/atlas_teleop/drc_vehicle_teleop.py	Mon May 20 17:57:31 2013 -0700
+++ b/tutorials/atlas_teleop/drc_vehicle_teleop.py	Mon May 20 19:14:21 2013 -0700
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@
 import rospy
 from sensor_msgs.msg import Joy
 from geometry_msgs.msg import Pose
-from std_msgs.msg import Float64, Int8
+from std_msgs.msg import Float64, Int8, String
 
 import math
 
@@ -16,6 +16,7 @@
         self.joy_sub = rospy.Subscriber('joy', Joy, self.joy_cb)
         self.robot_enter_car = rospy.Publisher('drc_world/robot_enter_car', Pose)
         self.robot_exit_car = rospy.Publisher('drc_world/robot_exit_car', Pose)
+        self.mode = rospy.Publisher('atlas/mode', String)
         self.brake_pedal = rospy.Publisher('drc_vehicle/brake_pedal/cmd', Float64)
         self.gas_pedal = rospy.Publisher('drc_vehicle/gas_pedal/cmd', Float64)
         self.hand_brake = rospy.Publisher('drc_vehicle/hand_brake/cmd', Float64)
@@ -30,12 +31,15 @@
 
         self.BUTTON_ENTER_CAR = 0
         self.BUTTON_EXIT_CAR = 1
+        self.BUTTON_NOMINAL = 2
 
     def joy_cb(self, data):
         if data.buttons[self.BUTTON_ENTER_CAR] == 1:
             self.robot_enter_car.publish(Pose())
         elif data.buttons[self.BUTTON_EXIT_CAR] == 1:
             self.robot_exit_car.publish(Pose())
+        elif data.buttons[self.BUTTON_NOMINAL] == 1:
+            self.mode.publish('nominal')
         else:
             self.hand_brake.publish(Float64(data.axes[self.AXIS_HAND_BRAKE]))
             self.brake_pedal.publish(Float64(data.axes[self.AXIS_BRAKE_PEDAL]))
~~~
I'll test more tomorrow.
content.html:
The exit car doesn't seem to work for me. I tried adding some code to send 'nominal' to atlas/mode, but the buttons are acting weird.

diff -r 7ac1e149f82e tutorials/atlas_teleop/drc_vehicle_teleop.py
--- a/tutorials/atlas_teleop/drc_vehicle_teleop.py  Mon May 20 17:57:31 2013 -0700
+++ b/tutorials/atlas_teleop/drc_vehicle_teleop.py  Mon May 20 19:14:21 2013 -0700
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@
 import rospy
 from sensor_msgs.msg import Joy
 from geometry_msgs.msg import Pose
-from std_msgs.msg import Float64, Int8
+from std_msgs.msg import Float64, Int8, String

 import math

@@ -16,6 +16,7 @@
         self.joy_sub = rospy.Subscriber('joy', Joy, self.joy_cb)
         self.robot_enter_car = rospy.Publisher('drc_world/robot_enter_car', Pose)
         self.robot_exit_car = rospy.Publisher('drc_world/robot_exit_car', Pose)
+        self.mode = rospy.Publisher('atlas/mode', String)
         self.brake_pedal = rospy.Publisher('drc_vehicle/brake_pedal/cmd', Float64)
         self.gas_pedal = rospy.Publisher('drc_vehicle/gas_pedal/cmd', Float64)
         self.hand_brake = rospy.Publisher('drc_vehicle/hand_brake/cmd', Float64)
@@ -30,12 +31,15 @@

         self.BUTTON_ENTER_CAR = 0
         self.BUTTON_EXIT_CAR = 1
+        self.BUTTON_NOMINAL = 2

     def joy_cb(self, data):
         if data.buttons[self.BUTTON_ENTER_CAR] == 1:
             self.robot_enter_car.publish(Pose())
         elif data.buttons[self.BUTTON_EXIT_CAR] == 1:
             self.robot_exit_car.publish(Pose())
+        elif data.buttons[self.BUTTON_NOMINAL] == 1:
+            self.mode.publish('nominal')
         else:
             self.hand_brake.publish(Float64(data.axes[self.AXIS_HAND_BRAKE]))
             self.brake_pedal.publish(Float64(data.axes[self.AXIS_BRAKE_PEDAL]))

I'll test more tomorrow.

pullrequest.title: add slider teleop for drc_vehicle using cheats

content.raw: Enter/Exit the car seems to be working fine for me.
content.html: Enter/Exit the car seems to be working fine for me.

pullrequest.title: add slider teleop for drc_vehicle using cheats

content.raw: @scpeters: are you sure you're hitting the right buttons?  Buttons 0 and 1 are both to the left of the leftmost slider (I don't remember which is top and which is bottom).  An easy way to check the button output is to `rostopic echo /joy`.
content.html: @scpeters: are you sure you're hitting the right buttons? Buttons 0 and 1 are both to the left of the leftmost slider (I don't remember which is top and which is bottom). An easy way to check the button output is to rostopic echo /joy.

pullrequest.title: add slider teleop for drc_vehicle using cheats

content.raw: You are correct; I saw the numbers at the top of the slider and assumed those were the button numbers.
content.html: You are correct; I saw the numbers at the top of the slider and assumed those were the button numbers.
